intro: Psychotria impercepta, commonly known as the "invisible psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its elusive nature and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its genus.
